words.definition: To acquaint is to get to know something or someone.
words.example: Nancy acquainted herself with the new computer.

words.definition: A cemetery is where people are buried when they die.
words.example: Some people are scared of cemeteries.

words.definition: To curse someone or something is to hope that bad things happen to them.
words.example: The witch cursed the village.

words.definition: A disguise is something you wear so people cannot tell who you are.
words.example: He wore a disguise so that no one would know who he was.

words.definition: If something is fancy, it is nice and expensive.
words.example: Their house was very fancy.

words.definition: A flashlight is a small electric light that you carry in your hand.
words.example: We used a flashlight to see in the dark cave.

words.definition: A hood is part of a coat that goes over your head.
words.example: Put on your hood because it is raining.

words.definition: An inhabitant is a person who lives in a certain place.
words.example: The GS most of the inhabitants in our city are friendly.

words.definition: To nourish something is to give it food that it needs to live.
words.example: A good diet will nourish your body.

words.definition: A pirate is a sailor who steals from other ships.
words.example: The GS the pirates were looking for treasure.

words.definition: A publication is a book, magazine, or newspaper that is printed.
words.example: She was happy to see her story in a publication.

words.definition: A riddle is a question that is difficult and has a funny answer.
words.example: I could not solve the riddle.

words.definition: To rot is to be destroyed naturally.
words.example: The GS the apple was starting to rot.

words.definition: To scare someone is to make them afraid.
words.example: The loud noise scared the baby.

words.definition: If something happens shortly, it happens in a short time.
words.example: The bus will be here shortly.

words.definition: A skeleton is all of the bones of a person or animal.
words.example: There was a skeleton in the science classroom.

words.definition: To spoil something is to make it bad or not useful.
words.example: The GS the rain spoiled our picnic.

words.definition: To starve is to go without food for a long time.
words.example: The GS the people were starving because there was no food.

words.definition: A thrill is an exciting feeling.
words.example: The GS the roller coaster was a great thrill.

words.definition: If something is wicked, it is very bad or evil.
words.example: The GS the wicked witch cast a spell on the prince.
